title: Share of children who are stunted
nameOfSource: UNICEF, World Health Organization and World Bank
subtitle: The share of children younger than five years old whose growth is stunted. Stunting is when a child is significantly shorter than the average for their age. Stunted growth is a consequence of poor nutrition and/or repeated infection.
